creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: large open brown wood gateway; pond in foreground with rocks; group of figures walking beneath gateway with other figures in middle and background; mountain in far background
marks: left: 自摺　昭和拾四年作　鼠ヶ関弁天島(旧漢字) {jizuri, Shōwa jūyone LRC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Benten Torii at Nezugaseki
